summary: An ordinance repealing Ordinance No. 1372 entitled: "An ordinance granting to the Portland and Puget Sound Railroad Company, its successors and assigns, the right and authority to locate, construct, lay down, operate and maintain, a standard gauge railroad, consisting of one or more tracks, upon and along a tract or tracts of land hereinafter described and to operate said railroad upon the conditions prescribed in this ordinance" approved June 9, 1890.
